item.title: Priority_queue
item.description: priority_queue using top(), pop(), empty(), … queue using front(), pop(), back(), … deque using push_front(), push_back(), pop_front(), pop_back(), … priority_queue # Example of priority_queue priority_queue<int> pq; pq.push(10); pq.push(20); pq.push(30); pq.push(40); pq.push(12); pq.push(1); pq.push(5); Default C++ creates a max-heap for priority queue while(!pq.empty()){ cout<< pq.top()<< " "; pq.pop(); } // 40 30 20 12 10 5 1 pq.size(); // 7 pq.top(); // 40 pq.pop(); // 30 20 12 10 5 1 Creating min-heap for priority queue while(!
